discussion.content:
the question says: "In a single cluster VM encryption scenario, which two VMs should be executed from encryption? :

if A is the correct answer, the precondition/assumption is the deploy shall be vCenter with external PSC, since internal PSC will integrate with vCenter is one VMs.

for answer B, since it is the replication appliance, In a single cluster VM encryption scenario, if VM encrypted in the source, the target site may not able to recovery/bootup.

B&D does not need any precondition/assumption

Correct answer A and D.

vCenter and PSC. You shouldnâ€™t encrypt them using VM Encryption because they would then need to boot up to get their encryption key to boot up.

https://blogs.vmware.com/vsphere/2017/10/key-manager-concepts-toplogy-basics-vm-vsan-encryption.html

questions.question_text: In a single cluster VM encryption scenario, which two VMs should be executed from encryption? (Choose two.)
Which vSphere feature is designed to distribute space usage and I/O load across multiple datastores?

discussion.content:
D is the correct answer. SIOC doesn't monitor used space.
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2149938
Yes the correct answer is D

questions.question_text: A vSphere administrator creates a VM with 2 vCPUs and 4GB memory. A 3GB memory reservation is applied to the VM. What size is .vswp file when the VM is powered on?

discussion.content:
http://www.virtualizationguru.org/2012/06/virtual-machine-swap-file-size-vswp.html
Swap File is calculated using the below formula:
Allocated Memory to VM - Reserve Memory to VM = Size of Swap file (.vswp)

questions.question_text:
An administrator suspects poor VM performance. The administrator runs esxtop and sees the following output from the CPU and memory screens:
6:48:19pm up 4:22, 528 worlds, 8 VMs, 16 vCPUs, CPU load average: 0.26, 0.36, 0.16
VMKMEM/MB: 8151 managed: 407 minfree, 3055 rsvd, 5095 ursvd, high state
What can the administrator conclude from this output?

choices.A: The host has too many worlds running.
choices.D: The host is under CPU pressure.

discussion.content:
Answer C is correct . 
By using the notify switches policy, you can determine how the ESXi host communicates failover events. When a physical NIC connects to the virtual switch or when traffic is rerouted to a different physical NIC in the team, the virtual switch sends notifications over the network to update the lookup tables on physical switches. Notifying the physical switch offers lowest latency when a failover or a migration with vSphere vMotion occurs.

questions.question_text: Which teaming and failover policy offers the lowest latency when a failover or a migration with vSphere vMotion occurs?
